skill.name: systematic-debugging
skill.description: Four-phase debugging methodology with root cause analysis. Use when investigating bugs, fixing test failures, or troubleshooting unexpected behavior. Emphasizes NO FIXES WITHOUT ROOT CAUSE FIRST.
skill.summary: Four-phase debugging methodology with root cause analysis. Use when investigating bugs, fixing test ...
skill.author: ChrisWiles

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and guidance. No executable code, network calls, filesystem access, or command execution capabilities. This is a markdown file that provides a structured debugging methodology for AI assistants.

content.value_statement: Debugging without a systematic approach leads to symptom-focused patches that mask underlying problems. This skill enforces a four-phase methodology that traces problems to their source before any fixes are applied, resulting in higher-quality solutions that do not create new bugs.
actual_capabilities: Four-phase debugging framework: investigation, pattern analysis, hypothesis testing, and implementation
Root cause tracing technique that follows invalid data backward through the call chain
Scientific method approach to forming and testing hypotheses about bug causes
Failing test creation before implementing fixes to capture bug behavior
Debugging checklists to verify all steps are completed before claiming a bug is fixed
Scenarios for test failures, runtime errors, intermittent issues, and regression detection
limitations: This is a prompt skill that guides AI behavior, not a debugging tool that directly analyzes code
The methodology requires human oversight for architectural decisions after repeated failed attempts
Does not execute code or interact with debugging tools directly

use_cases.title: Fix bugs systematically
use_cases.description: Apply root cause analysis to trace bugs to their origin before writing any fix code.

use_cases.title: Analyze test failures
use_cases.description: Investigate failing tests by tracing errors through the call chain to identify the source.

use_cases.title: Diagnose runtime issues
use_cases.description: Diagnose production issues by following the four-phase framework to find root causes.

prompt_templates.title: Basic debugging request
prompt_templates.scenario: When a user reports a bug
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the systematic debugging methodology. First, trace the root cause by following invalid data backward through the call chain. Never fix symptoms. What is the actual cause?

prompt_templates.title: Test failure analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply the test failure debugging scenario: read full error, identify assertion failure, check test setup and data, trace to source of unexpected value.

prompt_templates.title: Hypothesis formation
prompt_templates.prompt: Form one clear hypothesis about why the bug occurs. Design a minimal test that changes one variable. Predict the outcome before running.

prompt_templates.title: Prevention check
prompt_templates.prompt: Verify: root cause documented, hypothesis tested, fix addresses root cause, failing test created and passes, full suite passes, no quick-fix rationalization used.

output_examples.input: The login button is not working on the production server
output: ‚Ä¢ Error symptom: Login button click produces no response
‚Ä¢ Immediate cause: Button click handler not firing
‚Ä¢ Tracing up: Event listener not attached due to missing DOM element
‚Ä¢ Root cause: Component renders conditionally before auth state is initialized
‚Ä¢ Working example: Login works in staging environment
‚Ä¢ Difference: Staging has pre-rendered auth state, production conditionally renders
‚Ä¢ The login button is conditionally rendered based on auth state
‚Ä¢ Auth state initialization is asynchronous in production but mocked synchronously in staging
‚Ä¢ Race condition causes button to not render on initial load
‚úÖ Fix: Ensure auth state is initialized before conditional rendering check

best_practices: Always trace root cause before touching any code. The symptom location is rarely where the problem started.
Create a failing test that reproduces the bug before implementing any fix.
Stop after three consecutive failed fix attempts and escalate to team discussion about architectural problems.
anti_patterns: Quick fixes applied without understanding the root cause
Fixing the error location instead of tracing where invalid data originated
Continuing to try fixes without forming a clear hypothesis first

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It guides the AI assistant to follow the four-phase debugging methodology.

faq.question: What types of bugs can this methodology handle?
faq.answer: The framework covers test failures, runtime errors, regressions from recent changes, and intermittent issues like race conditions.

faq.question: How does this integrate with testing skills?
faq.answer: Use this skill with testing-patterns to create failing test cases that reproduce bugs before implementing any fix.

faq.question: Is any data stored or processed externally?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based skill with no code execution, network calls, or external data processing.

faq.question: What if three fixes fail in a row?
faq.answer: The methodology explicitly stops after three failed attempts. This signals architectural problems that require team discussion.

faq.question: How is this different from ad-hoc debugging?
faq.answer: Systematic debugging follows a four-phase framework with documented hypothesis testing, achieving higher first-time fix rates.
